intro: Gymnopsis glaberrima, commonly known as the smooth bladder nut, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its fruit is a dry, two-lobed capsule that contains several seeds. Gymnopsis glaberrima is often found in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in wetlands.
